newsitem.title: USA: CACI wins contract with Defense office.
newsitem.headline: CACI wins contract with Defense office.

text.p: CACI International Inc said Monday it has been awarded a contract by the office of the secretary of defense's program analysis and evaluation office.

CACI said the contract is one of two contracts awarded by the office. The company said the combined value of the office's two contracts is $25 million, but a CACI spokeswoman declined to disclose how much money the company was getting from its contract.
CACI said the length of the cost plus fixed-fee contract is one year, with four one-year options.
CACI said the contract calls for it to provide technical support in developing the office's joint warfare system.
The joint warfare system models and simulates military campaigns.
CACI said it will begin its work this week at a government facility in Arlington, Virginia.
